intro: Alsinanthus triflorus, commonly known as the three-flowered alsinanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive seed pods and often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, three-parted inflorescences, giving it its common name. Alsinanthus triflorus is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
